00026 /// Processes all HTTP GETS
00027 
00028 HTTP_IO_RESULT HTTPExecuteGet(void) {
00029 
00030         BYTE *ptr;
00031         BYTE filename[20];
00032         int DeviceID = 0;
00033         int short ExitDelay;
00034 
00035         // Load the file name
00036         // Make sure BYTE filename[] above is large enough for your longest name
00037         MPFSGetFilename(curHTTP.file, filename, 20);
00038         /*
00039          #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00040          putrsUART((ROM char*)"HTTP Get received from file:");
00041          putsUART(filename);
00042          putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00043          #endif
00044          */
00045 
00046 
00047         // ######### Zone configuration #########
00048         if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/zoneconfig.htm", 20)) {
00049 
00050                 if(AlarmState == Disarmed) {
00051 
00052 
00053                         //ID of the zone
00054                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"id");
00055                         if(*ptr)
00056                                 DeviceID = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr,(ROM BYTE *)"Zone ID");
00057 
00058                         // Bypass the zone
00059                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"bypass");
00060                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00061                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00062                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00063                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Bypass);
00064                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00065 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00066                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Bypass of Zone\r\n");
00067 #endif
00068                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00069                         }
00070 
00071                         // Isolate the zone
00072                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"isolate");
00073                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00074                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00075                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00076                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Isolate);
00077                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00078 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00079                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Isolate\r\n");
00080 #endif
00081                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00082                         }
00083 
00084 
00085                         // Enable the zone
00086                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"enable");
00087                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00088                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00089                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00090                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Enable);
00091 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00092                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"web enable\r\n");
00093 #endif
00094                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00095                         }
00096 
00097                         // Normaly Open
00098                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"no");
00099 
00100                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00101                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsNO = TRUE;
00102 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00103                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Normaly Open = True\r\n");
00104 #endif
00105                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00106                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00107                         }
00108                         if(*ptr == '0') {
00109                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsNO = FALSE;
00110 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00111                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Normaly Open = False\r\n");
00112 #endif
00113                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00114                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00115                         }
00116 
00117 
00118                         // Entry Zone
00119                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"entry");
00120 
00121                         if(*ptr == '1') {
00122                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsEntry = TRUE;
00123 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00124                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Entry = True\r\n");
00125 #endif
00126                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00127                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00128                         }
00129                         if(*ptr == '0')  {
00130                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].IsEntry = FALSE;
00131 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00132                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Entry = False\r\n");
00133 #endif
00134                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00135                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00136                         }
00137 
00138 
00139                         // Zone type ( perimeter,interior,24hour)
00140                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"type");
00141                         if((*ptr)&& (*ptr != 'a')) {
00142                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].ZoneType = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Zone type");
00143                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00144                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00145                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00146                         }//if(prt)
00147 
00148 
00149                         // Zone alarm type ( fire, flood gas)
00150                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"alarmtype");
00151                         if((*ptr)&& (*ptr != 'a')) {
00152                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].ZoneAlarmType = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Zone alarm type");
00153                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00154                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00155                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00156                         }//if(prt)
00157 
00158 
00159 
00160                         // Zones area list as a single digit integer
00161                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"arealist");
00162                         if((*ptr)&& (*ptr != 'a')) {
00163                                 ZoneConfig[DeviceID].AreaList = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Zone area list");
00164                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00165                                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));      //now save the changes
00166                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00167                         }//if(prt)
00168 
00169 
00170                         // Zones description
00171                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"desc");
00172                         if((*ptr)&& (*ptr != '\0')) {
00173 
00174                                 iCount = EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC;
00175                                 if (DeviceID != 0)
00176                                         iCount += ((int)DeviceID * DEVICEDESCLENGTH) + 1;
00177 
00178                                 SaveDeviceDescription(iCount, ptr);
00179                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00180                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00181                         }//if(prt)
00182 
00183                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/zoneconfig.htm");
00184                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00185 
00186 
00187                 } //    if(AlarmState == Disarmed) {
00188                 else {
00189                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/disarmconfig_error.htm");
00190                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00191                 } // AlarmState != Disarmed
00192 
00193         }// zoneconfig.htm
00194 
00195         // ######### Area configuration #########
00196         else if (!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/areaconfig.htm", 20)) {
00197 
00198                 if(AlarmState == Disarmed) {
00199 
00200                         //ID of the Area
00201                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"id");
00202                         if(*ptr)
00203                                 DeviceID = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr,(ROM BYTE *)"Area ID");

00205                         // Bypass the area
00206                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"bypass");
00207                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00208                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00209                                 AreaConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00210                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Bypass);
00211 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00212                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Bypass of Area\r\n");
00213 #endif
00214                         }
00215 
00216 
00217                         // Isolate the area
00218                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"isolate");
00219                         if(*ptr == '1')  {
00220                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00221                                 AreaConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00222                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Isolate);
00223 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00224                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Isolate Area\r\n");
00225 #endif
00226                         }
00227 
00228                         // Enable the area
00229                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"enable");
00230                         if (*ptr == '1')  {
00231                                 ClearArmingFlags();
00232                                 AreaConfig[DeviceID].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
00233                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Enable);
00234 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00235                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Enable Area\r\n");
00236 #endif
00237                         }
00238 
00239 
00240                         // Area alarm type ( perimeter,interior,24hour)
00241                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"alarmtype");
00242                         if ((*ptr)&& (*ptr != 'a')) {
00243                                 AreaConfig[DeviceID].ZoneAlarmType = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Zone Alarm Type");
00244                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00245                         }//if(prt)
00246 
00247                         // Area description
00248                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"desc");
00249                         if((*ptr) && (*ptr != '\0')) {
00250

00252                                 if (DeviceID != 0)
00253                                         iCount += DeviceID * (int)DEVICEDESCLENGTH;
00254 
00255                                 SaveDeviceDescription( iCount, ptr);
00256                                 xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = TickGet() + (GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY * TICK_SECOND);
00257                         }//if(prt)
00258 
00259 
00260                         //now save the changes
00261                         xPLSaveEEConfig(AreaConfig, EEDATASTART_AREA, sizeof(AreaConfig));
00262 
00263                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/areaconfig.htm");
00264                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00265                         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00266 
00267 
00268                 } //    if(AlarmState == Disarmed)
00269                 else {
00270                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/disarmconfig_error.htm");
00271                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00272                 } // AlarmState != Disarmed
00273 
00274 
00275         } // areaconfig.htm
00276 
00277         //######### Alarm Control #############
00278         else if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "control.htm", 11)) {
00279 
00280                 // Delay
00281                 ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"delay");
00282 
00283                 if(*ptr == 'd') {
00284                         // load default value
00285 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00286                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Exit delay, default\r\n");
00287 #endif
00288                         ExitDelay = xPLConfig.ExitDelay;
00289                 } //d
00290 
00291                 else if(*ptr)
00292                         ExitDelay = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr,(ROM BYTE *) "Exit delay");
00293 
00294                 else
00295                         ExitDelay = xPLConfig.ExitDelay;
00296 
00297                 // Control
00298                 ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"control");
00299 
00300                 if(*ptr == 'd') {
00301 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00302                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Disarm Alarm system\r\n");
00303 #endif
00304                         Disarm();
00305                 } //d
00306 
00307                 if(*ptr == 'h') {
00308 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00309                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Arm Home\r\n");
00310 #endif
00311                         ArmHome (ExitDelay);
00312                 } //h
00313 
00314 
00315                 if(*ptr == 'a') {
00316 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00317                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Arm Away\r\n");
00318 #endif
00319                         ArmAway (ExitDelay);
00320                 } //a
00321 
00322                 if(*ptr == 'l') {
00323 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00324                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Arm Latch key\r\n");
00325 #endif
00326                         ArmLatchkey (ExitDelay);
00327 
00328                 } //l
00329 
00330                 if(*ptr == 'p') {
00331 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00332                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Panic\r\n");
00333 #endif
00334                         Panic ();
00335                 } //p
00336 
00337 
00338                 // Clean the URL
00339                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/control.htm");
00340                 curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00341                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00342 
00343         } //control.htm
00344 
00345         //######### Alarm Configuration #############
00346         else if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/alarmconfig.ht", 20)) {
00347 
00348                 if(AlarmState == Disarmed) {
00349 
00350 
00351                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"TestNTP");
00352                         if(*ptr =='1') {
00353                                 if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_DONE) {
00354                                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_PROGRESS;
00355 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00356                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" - TEST done state\r\n");
00357 #endif
00358                                         if (SNTPState == SM_WAIT || SNTPState == SM_SHORT_WAIT){
00359                                                 SNTPState = SM_HOME;
00360 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00361                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" - TEST SM_HOMe\r\n");
00362 #endif
00363                                         }
00364                                         else {
00365                                                 NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT;
00366 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00367                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" - TEST timeout from start\r\n");
00368 #endif
00369                                         }
00370                                 }
00371 
00372                                 if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_PROGRESS)
00373                                         return HTTP_IO_WAITING;
00374 
00375 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00376                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" - fuck a duck\r\n");
00377 #endif
00378                                 // redirect the to result of the test email
00379                                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/NTPtest.htm");
00380                                 curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00381                                 return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00382                         }
00383 
00384 
00385 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00386                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Alarm is being updated\r\n");
00387 #endif
00388 
00389 
00390                         // Instance ID
00391 
00392                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"Ins");
00393 
00394                         if(*ptr) {
00395 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00396                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"instance \r\n");
00397 #endif
00398                                 for(iCount = 0;((*ptr != '\0') && (iCount < sizeof(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID))); iCount++) {
00399                                         if(*ptr >= 'A' && *ptr <= 'Z')
00400                                                 *ptr -= 'A' - 'a'; //Convert to lower case
00401                                         if((*ptr < '0') || (*ptr > 'z') || (*ptr > '9' && *ptr < 'a')) *ptr = '0'; // only accept 0 - 9 and a - z
00402                                         xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID[iCount] = *ptr;
00403                                         ptr++;
00404                                 }// for
00405                                 xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID[iCount] = '\0';
00406 
00407                         } //ptr
00408 
00409                         // Heart Beat interval
00410                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"Int");
00411                         if(*ptr)
00412                                 xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Heart Beat interval");
00413 
00414                         // Exit delay
00415                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"ExD");
00416                         if(*ptr)
00417                                 xPLConfig.ExitDelay = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Exit Delay");
00418 
00419                         // Entry Delay
00420                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"EnD");
00421                         if(*ptr)
00422                                 xPLConfig.EntryDelay = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Entry Delay");
00423 
00424                         // Alarming Duration
00425                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"ADu");
00426                         if(*ptr)
00427                                 xPLConfig.AlarmingDuration = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Alarming Duration");
00428 
00429                         // Alarming 24hour Duration
00430                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"AD2");
00431                         if(*ptr)
00432                                 xPLConfig.Alarming24Duration = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Alarming 24hour Duration");
00433 
00434                         // Siren Delay 24h
00435                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"SD2");
00436                         if(*ptr)
00437                                 xPLConfig.SirenDelay24h = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Siren Delay 24h");
00438 
00439                         // Heart Beat interval
00440                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"SDe");
00441                         if(*ptr)
00442                                 xPLConfig.SirenDelay = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr, (ROM BYTE *)"Siren Delay");
00443 
00444                         // NTP Server name
00445                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"NTP");
00446                         if(*ptr) {
00447 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00448                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"NTP Server \r\n");
00449 #endif
00450                                 memset(xPLConfig.NTP_Server, '\0', sizeof(xPLConfig.NTP_Server));
00451 
00452                                 for(iCount = 0;((*ptr != '\0') && (iCount < sizeof(xPLConfig.NTP_Server))); iCount++) {
00453                                         if(*ptr >= 'A' && *ptr <= 'Z')
00454                                                 *ptr -= 'A' - 'a'; //Convert to lower case
00455                                         xPLConfig.NTP_Server[iCount] = *ptr;
00456                                         ptr++;
00457                                 }// for
00458                                 xPLConfig.NTP_Server[iCount] = '\0';
00459 
00460                         } //ptr
00461 
00462                         // UseAES
00463                         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"UseAES");
00464                         if(*ptr == '1')
00465                                 xPLConfig.Use_AES = TRUE;
00466                         if(*ptr == '0')
00467                                 xPLConfig.Use_AES = FALSE;
00468 
00469 
00470                         // now we save the shit
00471                         xPLSaveEEConfig(&xPLConfig, EEDATASTART_XPL, sizeof(xPLConfig));
00472 
00473                         // Clean the URL
00474                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/alarmconfig.htm");
00475                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00476                         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00477 
00478 
00479 
00480                 }//     if(AlarmState != Disarmed)
00481                 else {
00482 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00483                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Disarm the alarm before updating the config\r\n");
00484 #endif
00485 
00486                         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/disarmconfig_error.htm");
00487                         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00488                         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00489                 } // AlarmState != Disarmed
00490 
00491 
00492         } //admin/alarmconfig.htm
00493 
00494         //######### User Authentication #############
00495         else if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/users.htm", 14))
00496                 ModifyUser(ptr);
00497 
00498         //######### Send Test Email #############
00499         else if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "email/index.htm", 15)) {
00500 
00501                 if (SMPTTestResult == SMTP_TEST_DONE) {
00502                         SMPTTestResult = SMTP_TEST_WAITING;
00503                         SMTPQueueEmail(SMTP_Test);
00504                 }
00505 
00506                 if (SMPTTestResult == SMTP_TEST_WAITING)
00507                         return HTTP_IO_WAITING;
00508 
00509                 // redirect the to result of the test email
00510                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/email/test.htm");
00511                 curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00512 
00513         }
00514 
00515 
00516         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00517 
00518 
00519 }

00521 
00522 //******************************************************************************
00523 /**
00524  Writes the device description to the EE Prom
00525  */
00526 void SaveDeviceDescription(int StartAddress, BYTE *p) {
00527 
00528         for(iCount = 0; iCount < DEVICEDESCLENGTH; iCount++) {
00529                 XEEBeginWrite(StartAddress + iCount);
00530                 if(iCount > strlen(p))
00531                         XEEWrite('\0');
00532                 else
00533                         XEEWrite(p[iCount]);
00534                 XEEEndWrite();
00535                 while(XEEIsBusy());
00536         }
00537 
00538 } // SaveDeviceDescription
00539 
00540 //******************************************************************************
00541 /// Decodes and int value from a HTTP buffer (GET)
00542 int DecodeIntFromGET(BYTE *GETptr, rom char * DebugMesg) {
00543 
00544         char Tempdigits[4];
00545 
00546         memset(Tempdigits,'\0',sizeof(Tempdigits));
00547 
00548         for(iCount = 0;(*GETptr != '\0') && (iCount < sizeof(Tempdigits) -1); iCount++) {
00549                 if((*GETptr < '0') || (*GETptr > '9')) *GETptr = '0'; // only accept 0 - 9
00550                 Tempdigits[iCount] = *GETptr;
00551                 GETptr++;
00552         }// for
00553 
00554 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00555         putrsUART(DebugMesg);
00556         putrsUART((ROM char*)" = ");
00557         putsUART(Tempdigits);
00558         putrsUART((ROM char*) "\r\n");
00559 #endif
00560 
00561         if (atoi(Tempdigits) >= 1) return atoi(Tempdigits);
00562         return 0;
00563 }
00564 
00565 
00566 //******************************************************************************
00567 //
00568 //                                                      POST SUBMISSION
00569 //
00570 //******************************************************************************
00571 /// Processes HTTP POST's
00572 
00573 HTTP_IO_RESULT HTTPExecutePost(void) {
00574 
00575         // Resolve which function to use and pass along
00576         BYTE filename[20];
00577 
00578         // Load the file name
00579         // Make sure BYTE filename[] above is large enough for your longest name
00580         MPFSGetFilename(curHTTP.file, filename, 20);
00581 
00582 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00583         putrsUART((ROM char*)"HTTP POST received from file:");
00584         putsUART(filename);
00585         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00586 #endif
00587 
00588 
00589         if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/ipconfig.htm", 18))
00590                 return HTTPPostConfig();
00591 
00592 #if defined STACK_USE_DYNAMICDNS_CLIENT
00593 
00594         if(!memcmppgm2ram(filename, "admin/dyndns.htm", 18))
00595                 return HTTPPostDDNSConfig();
00596 
00597 #endif // DYNDNS
00598 
00599         if(!strcmppgm2ram((char*)filename, "email/index.htm"))
00600                 return HTTPPostSMTPConfig();
00601 
00602         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00603 }
00604 
00605 //*********************************************************************
00606 /**
00607  * Function:        HTTP_IO_RESULT HTTPPostConfig(void)
00608  *
00609  * PreCondition:    curHTTP is loaded
00610  *
00611  * Input:           None
00612  *
00613  * Output:          HTTP_IO_DONE on success
00614  *                                      HTTP_IO_NEED_DATA if more data is requested
00615  *                                      HTTP_IO_WAITING if waiting for asynchronous process
00616  *
00617  * Side Effects:    None
00618  *
00619  * Overview:        This function reads an input parameter from
00620  *                                      the POSTed data, and writes that string to the
00621  *                                      AppConfig (NIC related config).
00622  *
00623  * Note:            None
00624  ********************************************************************/
00625 
00626 #define HTTP_POST_CONFIG_MAX_LEN        (HTTP_MAX_DATA_LEN - sizeof(AppConfig) - 3)
00627 
00628 static HTTP_IO_RESULT HTTPPostConfig(void) {
00629         APP_CONFIG *app;
00630         BYTE *ptr;
00631         WORD len;
00632 
00633         // Set app config pointer to use data array
00634         app = (APP_CONFIG*)&curHTTP.data[HTTP_POST_CONFIG_MAX_LEN];
00635 
00636         // Use data[0] as a state machine.  0x01 is initialized, 0x02 is error, else uninit
00637         if(curHTTP.data[0] != 0x01 && curHTTP.data[0] != 0x02)
00638         {
00639                 // First run, so use current config as defaults
00640                 memcpy((void*)app, (void*)&AppConfig, sizeof(AppConfig));
00641                 app->Flags.bIsDHCPEnabled = 0;
00642                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x01;
00643         }
00644 
00645 
00646         // if TCPFind == 0xffff means no result
00647         // curHTTP.byteCount = How many bytes have been read so far
00648         // TCPIsGetReady = number of bytes available in socket
00649         // sktHTTP = Access the current socket
00650 
00651 
00652 
00653         // Loop over all parameters
00654         while(curHTTP.byteCount) // how many bytes have been read so far
00655         {
00656                 // Find end of next parameter string
00657                 len = TCPFind(sktHTTP, '&', 0, FALSE);
00658 
00659                 // if '&' was not found and number of bytes in socket == bytes read so far
00660                 if(len == 0xffff && TCPIsGetReady(sktHTTP) == curHTTP.byteCount)
00661                         len = TCPIsGetReady(sktHTTP);
00662 
00663                 // If there's no end in sight, then ask for more data
00664                 if(len == 0xffff)
00665                         return HTTP_IO_NEED_DATA;
00666 
00667                 // Read in as much data as we can
00668                 if(len > HTTP_MAX_DATA_LEN-sizeof(AppConfig))
00669                 {// If there's too much, read as much as possible
00670                         curHTTP.byteCount -= TCPGetArray(sktHTTP, curHTTP.data+1, HTTP_POST_CONFIG_MAX_LEN);
00671                         curHTTP.byteCount -= TCPGetArray(sktHTTP, NULL, len - HTTP_POST_CONFIG_MAX_LEN);
00672                         curHTTP.data[HTTP_POST_CONFIG_MAX_LEN-1] = '\0';
00673                 }
00674                 else
00675                 {// Otherwise, read as much as we wanted to
00676                         curHTTP.byteCount -= TCPGetArray(sktHTTP, curHTTP.data+1, len);
00677                         curHTTP.data[len+1] = '\0';
00678                 }
00679 
00680                 // Decode the string
00681                 HTTPURLDecode(curHTTP.data+1);
00682 
00683                 // Compare the string to those we're looking for
00684                 if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "ip\0", 3))
00685                 {
00686                         if(StringToIPAddress(&curHTTP.data[3+1], &(app->MyIPAddr)))
00687                                 memcpy((void*)&(app->DefaultIPAddr), (void*)&(app->MyIPAddr), sizeof(IP_ADDR));
00688                         else
00689                                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x02;
00690                 }
00691                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "gw\0", 3))
00692                 {
00693                         if(!StringToIPAddress(&curHTTP.data[3+1], &(app->MyGateway)))
00694                                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x02;
00695                 }
00696                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "subnet\0", 7))
00697                 {
00698                         if(StringToIPAddress(&curHTTP.data[7+1], &(app->MyMask)))
00699                                 memcpy((void*)&(app->DefaultMask), (void*)&(app->MyMask), sizeof(IP_ADDR));
00700                         else
00701                                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x02;
00702                 }
00703                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "dns1\0", 5))
00704                 {
00705                         if(!StringToIPAddress(&curHTTP.data[5+1], &(app->PrimaryDNSServer)))
00706                                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x02;
00707                 }
00708                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "dns2\0", 5))
00709                 {
00710                         if(!StringToIPAddress(&curHTTP.data[5+1], &(app->SecondaryDNSServer)))
00711                                 curHTTP.data[0] = 0x02;
00712                 }
00713                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "mac\0", 4))
00714                 {
00715                         WORD_VAL w;
00716                         BYTE i, mac[12];
00717 
00718                         ptr = &curHTTP.data[4+1];
00719 
00720                         for(i = 0; i < 12; i++)
00721                         {// Read the MAC address
00722 
00723                                 // Skip non-hex bytes
00724                                 while( *ptr != 0x00 && !(*ptr >= '0' && *ptr < '9') && !(*ptr >= 'A' && *ptr <= 'F') && !(*ptr >= 'a' && *ptr <= 'f') )
00725                                         ptr++;
00726 
00727                                 // MAC string is over, so zeroize the rest
00728                                 if(*ptr == 0x00)
00729                                 {
00730                                         for(; i < 12; i++)
00731                                                 mac[i] = '0';
00732                                         break;
00733                                 }
00734 
00735                                 // Save the MAC byte
00736                                 mac[i] = *ptr++;
00737                         }
00738 
00739                         // Read MAC Address, one byte at a time
00740                         for(i = 0; i < 6; i++)
00741                         {
00742                                 w.v[1] = mac[i*2];
00743                                 w.v[0] = mac[i*2+1];
00744                                 app->MyMACAddr.v[i] = hexatob(w);
00745                         }
00746                 }
00747                 else if(!memcmppgm2ram(curHTTP.data+1, "host\0", 5))
00748                 {
00749                         memset(app->NetBIOSName, ' ', 15);
00750                         app->NetBIOSName[15] = 0x00;
00751                         memcpy((void*)app->NetBIOSName, (void*)&curHTTP.data[5+1], strlen((char*)&curHTTP.data[5+1]));
00752                         strupr((char*)app->NetBIOSName);
00753                 }
00754 
00755                 // Trash the separator character
00756                 while( TCPFind(sktHTTP, '&', 0, FALSE)  == 0 ||
00757                           TCPFind(sktHTTP, '\r', 0, FALSE) == 0 ||
00758                           TCPFind(sktHTTP, '\n', 0, FALSE) == 0  )
00759                 {
00760                         curHTTP.byteCount -= TCPGet(sktHTTP, NULL);
00761                 }
00762 
00763         }
00764 
00765 
00766         //We dont want DHCP as an option.
00767         app->Flags.bIsDHCPEnabled = 0;
00768 
00769         // Check if all settings were successful
00770         if(curHTTP.data[0] == 0x01)
00771         {// Save the new AppConfig
00772 
00773                 ptr = (BYTE*)app;
00774 #if defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM)
00775             XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_CONFIG);
00776             XEEWrite(XPLEECONFIGVERSION);
00777             for (len = 0; len < sizeof(AppConfig); len++ )
00778                 XEEWrite(*ptr++);
00779             XEEEndWrite();
00780         while(XEEIsBusy());
00781 #endif
00782 
00783                 // Set the board to reboot to the new address
00784                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/reboot.htm?");
00785                 memcpy((void*)(curHTTP.data+18), (void*)app->NetBIOSName, 16);
00786                 ptr = curHTTP.data;
00787                 while(*ptr != ' ' && *ptr != '\0')
00788                         ptr++;
00789                 *ptr = '\0';
00790         }
00791         else
00792         {// Error parsing IP, so don't save to avoid errors
00793                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/config_error.htm");
00794         }
00795 
00796         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;
00797 
00798         return HTTP_IO_DONE;
00799 }
00800 
00801 
00802

Generated on Mon Apr 25 2011 23:31:09 for Alarm Cabinent by  1.7.4
